1{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
2
3-- | Term picker is a data for picking target terms
4--   based on input heading terms.
5--   For example, when picking \/a \/b from \/a \/b \/c \/d \/e,
6--   use @termPicker@ like:
7--
8--   >>> let pk = termPicker ["a", "b"] ["a", "b", "c", "d", "e"]
9--   >>> pickTerms pk ["1", "2", "3", "4", "5"]
10--   ["1", "2"]
11
12module Koshucode.Baala.Data.Type.Rel.TermPicker
13  ( -- * Construct
14    TermPicker (..),
15    TermPick,
16    TermPick2,
17    termPicker,
18    -- * Pre & new terms
19    preTerms, newTerms, 
20    preTermsExist, newTermsExist,
21    -- * Mapping
22    picker,
23    pickTermsIndex,
24    pickTerms, cutTerms,
25    forwardTerms, backwardTerms, towardTerms,
26  ) where
27
28import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture              as O
29import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base                  as B
30import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax                as S
31import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Data.Type.JudgeClass  as D
32
33
34-- ---------------------- * Construct
35
36-- | Type for picking terms.
37type TermPick c = TermPicker c -> [c] -> [c]
38
39-- | Double picker.
40type TermPick2 a b = (TermPick a, TermPick b)
41
42-- | Data for picking terms.
43data TermPicker c = TermPicker
44    { ssLShareIndex  :: [Int]         -- ^ Indicies of right-shared part
45    , ssRShareIndex  :: [Int]         -- ^ Indicies of left-shared part
46    , ssDisjoint     :: Bool          -- ^ Whether shared part is empty
47
48    , ssLSideNames   :: [S.TermName]  -- ^ Left-side term names
49    , ssLShareNames  :: [S.TermName]  -- ^ Left-shared term names
50    , ssRShareNames  :: [S.TermName]  -- ^ Right-shared term names
51    , ssRSideNames   :: [S.TermName]  -- ^ Right-side term names
52
53    , ssLSide        :: [c] -> [c]    -- ^ Pick left-side part from left contents
54    , ssLShare       :: [c] -> [c]    -- ^ Pick left-shared part from left contents
55    , ssRShare       :: [c] -> [c]    -- ^ Pick right-shared part from right contents
56    , ssRSide        :: [c] -> [c]    -- ^ Pick right-side part from right contents
57
58    , ssRSplit       :: [c] -> ([c], [c])  -- ^ Pick right-shared and right-side part
59    , ssRAssoc       :: [c] -> ([c], [c])  -- ^ Pick right-shared part and right contents
60
61    , ssRForward     :: [c] -> [c]    -- ^ Move shared terms forward.
62    , ssRBackward    :: [c] -> [c]    -- ^ Move shared terms backward.
63    }
64
65-- | Create term picker from left and right term names.
66--
67--     >>> let ss = termPicker ["a", "b", "c"] ["b", "c", "d", "e"]
68--
69--     >>> ssDisjoint ss
70--     False
71--
72--   Left terms.
73--
74--     >>> ssLShareIndex ss
75--     [1, 2]
76--
77--     >>> ssLShareNames ss
78--     ["b", "c"]
79--
80--     >>> ssLSide ss "ABC"
81--     "A"
82--
83--     >>> ssLShare ss "ABC"
84--     "BC"
85--
86--   Right terms.
87--
88--     >>> ssRShareIndex ss
89--     [0, 1]
90--
91--     >>> ssRShareNames ss
92--     ["b", "c"]
93--
94--     >>> ssRSideNames ss
95--     ["d", "e"]
96--
97--     >>> ssRShare ss "BCDE"
98--     "BC"
99--
100--     >>> ssRSide ss "BCDE"
101--     "DE"
102--
103--     >>> ssRSplit ss "BCDE"
104--     ("BC", "DE")
105--
106--     >>> ssRAssoc ss "BCDE"
107--     ("BC", "BCDE")
108--
109--     >>> ssRForward ss "BCDE"
110--     "BCDE"
111--
112--     >>> ssRBackward ss "BCDE"
113--     "DEBC"
114--
115termPicker :: (D.GetTermNames l, D.GetTermNames r) => l -> r -> TermPicker c
116termPicker left right = termPickerBody (li, ri) (ln, rn) where
117    (ln, rn) = getTermNamesUnique2 left right
118    (li, ri) = doubleIndex ln rn $ B.keepMember rn ln
119
120doubleIndex :: (Ord a) => [a] -> [a] -> [a] -> Dbl [Int]
121doubleIndex ln rn xn = (B.snipIndex xn ln, B.snipIndex xn rn)
122
123-- | Double of something.
124type Dbl a = (a, a)
125
126-- | Get pair of term names.
127getTermNamesUnique2 :: (D.GetTermNames a, D.GetTermNames b) => a -> b -> Dbl [S.TermName]
128getTermNamesUnique2 l r = (D.getTermNamesUnique l, D.getTermNamesUnique r)
129
130termPickerBody :: Dbl [Int] -> Dbl [S.TermName] -> TermPicker a
131termPickerBody (li, ri) (ln, rn) = ss where
132    lside      = B.snipOff  li
133    lshare     = B.snipFrom li
134    rshare     = B.snipFrom ri
135    rside      = B.snipOff  ri
136    rfor       = B.snipForward  ri
137    rback      = B.snipBackward ri
138    rsplit xs  = (rshare xs, rside xs)
139    rassoc xs  = (rshare xs, xs)
140
141    ss = TermPicker
142         { ssLShareIndex  = li
143         , ssRShareIndex  = ri
144         , ssDisjoint     = null li
145         , ssLSideNames   = lside  ln
146         , ssLShareNames  = lshare ln
147         , ssRShareNames  = rshare rn
148         , ssRSideNames   = rside  rn
149         , ssLSide        = lside
150         , ssLShare       = lshare
151         , ssRShare       = rshare
152         , ssRSide        = rside
153         , ssRSplit       = rsplit
154         , ssRAssoc       = rassoc
155         , ssRForward     = rfor
156         , ssRBackward    = rback
157         }
158
159
160-- ---------------------- * Pre & new terms
161
162-- | List of present terms.
163--
164--   >>> preTerms $ termPicker (words "a b c") (words "a b d e")
165--   ["a","b"]
166--
167preTerms :: TermPicker c -> [S.TermName]
168preTerms = ssLShareNames
169
170-- | List of new terms.
171--
172--   >>> newTerms $ termPicker (words "a b c") (words "a b d e")
173--   ["c"]
174--
175newTerms :: TermPicker c -> [S.TermName]
176newTerms = ssLSideNames
177
178-- | Test present terms exist.
179--
180--   >>> preTermsExist $ termPicker (words "d e") (words "a b c")
181--   False
182--
183--   >>> preTermsExist $ termPicker (words "c d e") (words "a b c")
184--   True
185--
186preTermsExist :: O.Test (TermPicker c)
187preTermsExist = B.notNull . preTerms
188
189-- | Test new terms exist.
190--
191--   >>> newTermsExist $ termPicker (words "a b c") (words "a b d e")
192--   True
193--
194--   >>> newTermsExist $ termPicker (words "a b") (words "a b d e")
195--   False
196--
197newTermsExist :: O.Test (TermPicker c)
198newTermsExist = B.notNull . newTerms
199
200
201--  ---------------------- * Mapping
202
203-- | Pick contents.
204--
205--   >>> picker (words "a c") (words "a b c") (words "1 2 3")
206--   ["1", "3"]
207--
208picker :: (D.GetTermNames t1, D.GetTermNames t2) => t1 -> t2 -> O.Map [c]
209picker t1 t2 = pickTerms $ termPicker t1 t2
210
211-- | Extract indices of terms.
212--
213--   >>> pickTermsIndex $ termPicker (words "b d") (words "a b d e")
214--   [1,2]
215--
216pickTermsIndex :: TermPicker c -> [Int]
217pickTermsIndex = ssRShareIndex
218
219-- | Pick terms according to term picker.
220pickTerms :: TermPicker c -> O.Map [c]
221pickTerms = ssRShare
222
223-- | Cut terms according to term picker.
224cutTerms :: TermPicker c -> O.Map [c]
225cutTerms = ssRSide
226
227-- | Move terms forward.
228forwardTerms :: TermPicker c -> O.Map [c]
229forwardTerms = ssRForward
230
231-- | Move terms backward.
232backwardTerms :: TermPicker c -> O.Map [c]
233backwardTerms = ssRBackward
234
235-- | Move terms forward ('True') or backward ('False').
236--
237--   >>> let pk = termPicker (words "c b") (words "a b c d")
238--   >>> towardTerms True pk (words "A B C D")
239--   ["C","B","A","D"]
240--   >>> towardTerms False pk (words "A B C D")
241--   ["A","D","C","B"]
242--
243towardTerms :: Bool -> TermPicker c -> O.Map [c]
244towardTerms True  = forwardTerms
245towardTerms False = backwardTerms
246
